sentences.en: a languid wave of the hand
Arthur was so languid, indifferent and careless about the favours bestowed upon him.
sentences.cn: 亚瑟对别人的奉承如此厌烦, 淡漠,如此不以为意.

sentences.en: De Craye was languid over the question.
sentences.cn: 德·克雷对这个问题感到不快.

sentences.en: He greeted Charles with a languid wave of his hand.
sentences.cn: 他无精打采地挥挥手，算是和查尔斯打招呼。

sentences.en: His languid gaze says more than I can tell.
sentences.cn: 他凝视的目光表达的比我能读出的更多.

sentences.en: His languid manner annoys me when there's work to be done.
sentences.cn: 有工作要做的时候,他那懒散的态度总叫我着恼.

sentences.en: In a languid manner he designed to infuriate.
sentences.cn: 他显出无精打采的样子,故意想激怒她.

sentences.en: Lepidus shrugged his shoulders, but was too languid to reply.
sentences.cn: 勒庇多斯耸耸肩膀, 但是懒得回答.

sentences.en: Marianne fixed her eyes on her with a rational, though languid, gaze.
sentences.cn: 玛丽安眼睛凝视着她, 目光虽然疲弱, 却是清醒.

sentences.en: Miss Keelder's eyes were lively and Miss Helstone's languid.
sentences.cn: 基达尔小姐的眼睛炯炯有神,赫尔斯通小姐的眼睛则呆滞无神.

sentences.en: The air that came fragrantly to his brow revived his languid senses.
sentences.cn: 芳香的微风吹拂着他的额头,重振了他那疲惫的精神.

sentences.en: The illness made him feel languid.
sentences.cn: 疾病使他感到倦怠乏力.

sentences.en: The March wind is fretful , fretting the languid waves into murmurs.
sentences.cn: 三月的风躁动不安, 惹得倦怠的波浪哗哗作响.

sentences.en: They sat in Germaine Rocher's salon watching the languid mannequins preen and simper.
sentences.cn: 她们正坐在吉米·罗切的美术展览馆里,看着那些疲乏的服装模特炫耀服装和假笑.

sentences.en: Time spent at Jumby Bay can be as energetic or as languid as you wish.
sentences.cn: 来鬼湾消磨时光，动静皆宜，尽可随心所欲。

sentences.en: With a languid movement she eked out the thought that was in her.
sentences.cn: 这种无精打采的举动,恰恰把她心里的想法给补充得明明白白.

words.tran_cn: 疲倦地；不感兴趣地；不活泼地；阴沉地
疲倦；无精打采；柔情；呆滞

trans.tran_cn: 疲倦的，没精打采的，呆滞的，萧条的，慢吞吞
trans.tran_en: moving slowly and involving very little energy
